tag_list: boulder, entrepreneur, founder, marketer, startup, technologist, blogger, speaker
overview: Holly Hamann is Co-Founder and VP of Marketing of BlogFrog, a Boulder-based web 2.0 start-up that offers social and community-building tools for blogs and websites. She has spent 18 years helping to launch and grow start-ups in the internet, multimedia, bio-medical, entertainment, video, and other high-tech industries. She has spent many years researching and studying internet and social media use by teens, GenY, and women. She is a public speaker, contributing writer on technology and marketing to various publications, and was named “Marketer of the Year” in 2004 by the American Marketing Association. She is also a guest blogger for The HuffingtonPost. She holds a BA in Mathematics and Computer Science from Washington College and completed graduate studies in telecommunications at Johns Hopkins University. She lives outside Boulder, Colorado and blogs about technology and parenting on her blog Breadcrumz.
